conclusion: Identify the given information: pedestrian runs at constant speed, bus starts with uniform acceleration, pedestrian is 36 meters away when light turns green, light turns green after 8 seconds.
Pedestrian's velocity-time graph is a straight line with a slope of 8 m/s.
Bus's velocity-time graph is a straight line with a slope of 8 m/s.
Determine the time it takes for the bus to start moving: light turns green after 8 seconds.
Calculate the distance the bus travels in the time it takes to start moving: bus starts moving at t = 8 seconds.
Distance the bus travels in 8 seconds is given by the area under the bus's velocity-time graph from t = 0 to t = 8.
Integral of the velocity-time graph from t = 0 to t = 8 is 8t.
Distance the bus travels in 8 seconds is 8 * 8 = 64 meters.
Pedestrian is 36 meters away from the bus.
Pedestrian needs to cover the distance the bus travels in 8 seconds to catch up with the bus.
Distance the pedestrian needs to cover is 64 meters.
Compare the distances: distance the bus travels in 8 seconds is 64 meters, distance the pedestrian needs to cover is 64 meters.
Since the distance the bus travels in 8 seconds is equal to the distance the pedestrian needs to cover, the pedestrian can catch up with the bus.
Final Answer: Yes, the pedestrian can catch up with the bus.
